description: From Ancient Greek [Term?] (“again”) + [Term?] (“to baptize”). See baptize and Anabaptist.

verbs.description: anabaptize (third-person singular simple present anabaptizes, present participle anabaptizing, simple past and past participle anabaptized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To baptize or christen again; to rename.
examples: To say truth, though some call their profound Ignorances, New Lights, they were better Anabaptised into the Appellation of Extinguishers; carryed about with every winde.
